docs.snippet: An unusual turn of phrase, combined with Donald Trump’s unique pronunciation of it, has confused, and amused, listeners....
docs.lead_paragraph: An unusual turn of phrase, combined with Donald Trump’s unique pronunciation of it, has confused, and amused, listeners.
docs.abstract: Donald Trump's campaign says that presidential candidate has been saying phrase big league, not bigly; Trump has used phrase repeatedly in debates and at campaign rallies and speeches; audio analysis by linguists confirms claim.

headline.main: Yes, Trump Really Is Saying ‘Big League,’ Not ‘Bigly,’ Linguists Say
headline.print_headline: Yes, Trump Is Saying ‘Big League,’ Not ‘Bigly’

docs.snippet: Consumers in some states will also find significantly fewer insurance companies offering coverage under the Affordable Care Act....
docs.lead_paragraph: Consumers in some states will also find significantly fewer insurance companies offering coverage under the Affordable Care Act.
docs.abstract: Health and Human Services Dept announces that premiums for midlevel health plans under Affordable Care Act will rise by average of 25 percent in 2017, and that customers in some states will have fewer insurance plans to choose from; increase in premium rates in 2015 was 2 percent, and 7 percent in 2016; rising prices and shrinking options essentially ensure next president will have to make significant improvements to law.

headline.main: Some Health Plan Costs to Increase by an Average of 25 Percent, U.S. Says
headline.print_headline: Choices Fall in Health Law as Costs Rise

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

docs.snippet: Mr. Trump disparaged an actress named Jessica Drake, who over the weekend said that in 2006 he had groped and kissed her without her permission....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Trump disparaged an actress named Jessica Drake, who over the weekend said that in 2006 he had groped and kissed her without her permission.
docs.abstract: Donald Trump dismisses accusations by pornographic film actress Jessica Drake that he inappropriately groped and kissed her in 2006 and also offered her $10,000 to go to his hotel room.

headline.main: Donald Trump Dismisses Latest Accuser: ‘Oh, I’m Sure She’s Never Been Grabbed Before’
headline.print_headline: Another Accuser Comes Forward, to Be Dismissed by Trump

docs.snippet: Two senior African-American lawmakers urged Mrs. Clinton to fund turnout efforts in down-ballot races, warning that control of Congress will be crucial to her agenda if she wins....
docs.lead_paragraph: Two senior African-American lawmakers urged Mrs. Clinton to fund turnout efforts in down-ballot races, warning that control of Congress will be crucial to her agenda if she wins.
docs.abstract: Reps James E Clyburn and G K Butterfield, two senior African-American members of the House, urge Hillary Clinton to use some of her campaign war chest to mobilize black voters across country to increase chances of Democrats winning control of Congress.

headline.main: Black Democrats to Hillary Clinton: Send Money to Take Congress
headline.print_headline: Clinton Urged to Send Cash to Aid Congressional Races

docs.snippet: The president, widening his attack on Mr. Trump, excoriated Representative Joe Heck of Nevada and others for failing to reject the candidate earlier....
docs.lead_paragraph: The president, widening his attack on Mr. Trump, excoriated Representative Joe Heck of Nevada and others for failing to reject the candidate earlier.
docs.abstract: Pres Barack Obama denounces Republicans, including Nevada Rep Joe Heck, for having initially endorsed divisive politics of Donald J Trump, even if they have since withdrawn their support.

headline.main: For Republicans Abandoning Donald Trump, Obama Has a Message: ‘Too Late’

docs.snippet: Liane Golightly has finally decided who she'll vote for on Election Day. Hillary Clinton is not a choice the 30-year-old Republican would have predicted, nor one that excites her. But the former supporter of Ohio Gov. John Kasich says it's the onl...
docs.lead_paragraph: Liane Golightly has finally decided who she'll vote for on Election Day. Hillary Clinton is not a choice the 30-year-old Republican would have predicted, nor one that excites her. But the former supporter of Ohio Gov. John Kasich says it's the only choice she can make.
